member.name: F:Atom.Personalization.Constants.White
member.summary: Typically used as the back color of a control

member.name: F:Atom.Personalization.Constants.LightGray
member.summary: Typically used as the disabled color

member.name: F:Atom.Personalization.Constants.Gray
member.summary: Typically used as the text color of a control

member.name: F:Atom.Personalization.Constants.LightBlue
member.summary: Typically used to indicate a neutral state

member.name: F:Atom.Personalization.Constants.Blue
member.summary: Typically used to indicate a neutral state or the selected state

member.name: F:Atom.Personalization.Constants.DarkBlue
member.summary: Typically used to indicate a neutral state

member.name: F:Atom.Personalization.Constants.Green
member.summary: Typically used to indicate a successful or an active state

member.name: F:Atom.Personalization.Constants.Red
member.summary: Typically used to indicate an error state
